newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch money market rates virtually unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Dutch money market rates virtually unchanged.

text.p: Dutch money market rates were virtually unchanged, while the guilder gained little against the German mark on Thursday.
Dealers said they did not expect a change in the special advances rate this afternoon when the Dutch central bank sets a new advances pact at 1400 GMT.
The special advances rate has been pegged at 2.90 percent since March 10, 1997.
Call money rates were stable at 3.00 percent bid and two-month deposits were bid at an unchanged 3.10 percent.
Three-month deposits rose two basis points to 3.14 percent.
The guilder was slightly stronger, trading at 112.5025 per 100 marks versus 112.52 on Wednesday.
